tags: happy holidays from hardy and hannah
I hope you have a fantastic holiday
summary: “Happy Holidays from Hardy and Hannah” - Digital Oil Painting  I love alliteration! ^_^ Been a while since I last painted our...
caption:
“Happy Holidays from Hardy and Hannah” - Digital Oil Painting

I love alliteration! ^_^ Been a while since I last painted our favorite awkward turtle DI and his sexy but secretly dorky girlfriend. You just KNOW that Hannah talked him into wearing this to an ugly holiday sweater party (she’s wearing very high heels to be closer to his height) and then she sent out the picture as a holiday card. He’ll have to work very hard to be taken seriously at the precinct after that. LOL Happy holidays!

Please check the notes for my links, bear in mind that reblogs are very important while tumblr has links killed.

title: Shakespeare Quote faves
body:
One of my favorite quotes from Shakespeare is from Hamlet Prince of Denmark. (All of my faves are from Hamlet)

“Am I a coward?”

My favorite performance of this line and the monologue it comes from, in particular, is David Tennant’s version.

His surprisingly genuine and innocent tone with this one line really hits home, especially since when one thinks of Hamlet they think he’ll say it loud and angrily, and although Tennant does shout and rage through this role, the simple lines when Hamlet is alone are really what brings it to life.

Hamlet is loud and obnoxious in public and somber and quite by himself. The character is extremely developed and complex, and Tennant’s portrayal of him really does the play proper justice.

summary: I remeber watching the doctor’s daughter for the first time, knowing nothing about the who universe or the Who cast. I saw the...
body:
I remeber watching the doctor’s daughter for the first time, knowing nothing about the who universe or the Who cast. I saw the scenes below and was really confused. I thought: Why did they filmed it like that? It looks like they fancy eachother. This is super weird. They are father and daughter.”

And then those two scenes below happend i was like: Okay, now they will kiss. They are father and daughter but they WILL kiss!”

Well i wasn’t that wrong, wasn’t it?

tags: he was a brilliant villain in this
and I loved the various cast and crew members gushing about him
look at the air he got in that last photo!
I went ahead and labeled this part one
because I have enough photos for a part two
that I'll get around to eventually
editing to add:  I had this post queued to go at 10:30 this morning - but it didn't happen
but it was removed from my queue
so I guess tumblr ate it?
luckily my desktop computer still had my queue from yesterday open in a tab
so I was able to post it from there
otherwise it would be been gone
and i would have been sad
but sorry for posting it late
caption:
Behind the Scenes of Jessica Jones (Season One) - Part One

Interviewer ( Source [ X ] ): You’re the envy of millions because you get to work alongside noted dreamboat and geek icon David Tennant, who plays the villain. What makes him unique, among all the actors you’ve worked with? 

Krysten Ritter: His incredible talent and range and ability to do what he does. I mean, he could do a five-page scene over and over and over again and change it up every time and make it a little different and nuanced and varied. He’s a pro, through and through. Always knows his lines. Always hits his marks. Besides shooting amazing scenes with him, he is so fun on set. When they tell David that they’re ready for him on set, he gets up and he runs, he actually runs to set. Just because he’s excited! Everybody likes him as a person.

Interviewer: Well, he has to be extra-nice on set, given that his character is a murderer and a serial rapist. 

Krysten Ritter: People were in awe of what he was doing. They were just like, “Holy shit, do you see what David was doing in that scene?” Everybody commented on it.

Interviewer (Source [ X ]): David Tennant’s performance, so far from what I’ve seen, has really blown me away as Kilgrave. What was it like working with him while he was in character, he’s so truly horrifying so what was that like to work with on set?

Carrie-Anne Moss: I’ll tell you what, there’s a scene I have with him when I was watching him work and I was just so floored – he’s incredible. That guy just blew my mind because he plays such a diabolical, so scary of a person and yet there was a moment of such humanity that had so much compassion for this guy and yet never from a place of ‘oh I like him now’ you know? You don’t want this guy around you know what I mean? To play that character, and for me to be acting across from him and for a moment for me to feel like ‘aw poor guy,’ to have care for him – that’s brilliant acting. That guy is incredible.

Thank you to anyone/everyone who shared set photos!

blog.name: whovianfloozy
blog.title: The Whovian Floozy
blog.description:
My fandom name is Beachy, and this is a multi-fandom blog. 
I'm also a multi-shipper. It's likely I do not sail your ship, but I don't wank and expect visitors to play nicely as well. That includes not adding hate or negativity to my posts, altering them to suit your own ships, or removing my original comments. If you do, you will be blocked.
IRL they call me Doctor. Yep, I'm that old. Sometimes I write things that other people watch. It's all good! I like mocha latte with bourbon. A lot.
